authors.name: Technical  Outreach and Assistance for States Team
authors.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"au35r","text":"This protocol provides instructions to install and run the Cecret workflow as part of the StaPH-B Toolkit. Cecret produces SARS-CoV-2 consensus sequence assemblies from either single- or paired-end Illumina reads in fastq (or fastq.gz) format and assigns lineage classifications using Pangolin and Nextclade. This document applies to all whole-genome sequencing runs on the Illumina platform and downstream bioinformatics for public health laboratories.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9vq0o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6p271","text":"For technical assistance, please contact: TOAST@cdc.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ejft","text":"The opinions expressed here do not necessarily reflect the opinions of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention or the institutions with which the authors are affiliated.  The protocol content here is under development and is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":363,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":834,"length":12}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E9A7DD022DDE11EC9FDA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E9A7DD6C2DDE11EC9FDA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdo7f","text":"The Cecret assembly workflow can be installed as part of the StaPH-B Toolkit using the following commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3lqf7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"52h0h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9571,"name":"git clone https://github.com/StaPH-B/staphb_toolkit.git
cd staphb_toolkit/packaging/
python3 setup.py install --user
cd ../
export PATH=$PATH:$(pwd)","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"staphb_tookit Install","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"9E25C7006BE911EB9069897A7111DF78"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89fma","text":"Run the Cecret workflow to perform SARS-CoV-2 genome sequence assembly and lineage classification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8nq6l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1nale","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6fpi0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1jh97","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"kt8d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"958h3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5jet0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1s6pd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3t93h","text":"The input directory for Cecret should contain a set of single or paired-end (default) fastq.gz or fastq reads from amplicon prepared libraries. By default, Cecret is configured to use the ARTIC V3 primer set but can be customized to use other primer sets.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ee6ug","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":27,"style":"italic"},{"length":9,"offset":133,"style":"italic"}],"key":"flfrp","text":"In the examples below, the --profile argument is set to use Singularity containers, but Cecret works with Docker containers as well (--profile docker).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4a48r","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":37,"offset":55}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3tu2i","text":"Detailed descriptions of parameters are provided here: https://github.com/UPHL-BioNGS/Cecret","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"2DA0C1A6EB0E11EB958E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/UPHL-BioNGS/Cecret"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9572,"name":"#Input Sequencing Reads File Path: 
/Full_Path_to_Fastq_File_Directory/INPUT/SRR11953697

#Output Directory:
/Full_Path_to_Cecret_Output_Directory/SRR11953697_cecret_output","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Cecret Input and Output File Paths","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"C1C20DF06BF211EB9069897A7111DF78"}},"2":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9573,"name":"mkdir -p cachedir
SINGULARITY_CACHEDIR=/PATH/for/cache
staphb-wf cecret /Full_Path_to_Fastq_File_Directory/INPUT/SRR11953697 --output /Full_Path_to_Cecret_Output_Directory/SRR11953697_cecret_output --profile singularity","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Cecret Workflow Command","description":"Default cache directory is ~/.singularity/cache. -resume is available if you would like to retry an interrupted workflow.","can_edit":0,"guid":"74C4DBE0EB0E11EB8502BFC92E336DC9"}},"3":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9574,"name":"staphb-wf cecret --get_config
staphb-wf cecret /Full_Path_to_Fastq_File_Directory/INPUT/SRR11953697 --output /Full_Path_to_Cecret_Output_Directory/SRR11953697_cecret_output --profile singularity -c /Full_Path_to_Config_File_Directory/date_cecret.config","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Getting/Using an optional configuration file","description":"","can_edit":0,"guid":"A05244B3EB1011EB958E0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hbcn","text":"Information about output files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8p7cj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"a1p5p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apeos","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"355vh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"305mb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"v7vu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ba8m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4lffp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9c4s4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b4isk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7kjsq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6vfpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9575,"name":"cecret_run_results.txt                # information about the sequencing run that's compatible with legacy workflows
covid_samples.csv                     # only if supplied initially
cecret
|-aligned
| |-pretrimmed.sorted.bam
|-bamsnap
| |-sample
|   |-ivar
|     |-variant.png                   # png of variants identified via ivar
|   |-bcftools
|     |-variant.png                   # png of variants identified via bcftools
|-bedtools_multicov
| |-sample.multicov.txt               # depth per amplicon
|-consensus
| |-sample.consensus.fa               # the likely reason you are running this workflow
|-fastp
| |-sample_clean_PE1.fastq            # clean file: only if params.cleaner=fastp
| |-sample_clean_PE2.fastq            # clean file: only if params.cleaner=fastp
|-fastqc
| |-sample.fastqc.html
| |-sample.fastqc.zip
|-filter                              # optional: turns aligned bams into fastq files
| |-sample_filtered_R1.fastq
| |-sample_filtered_R2.fastq
| |-sample_filtered_unpaired.fastq
|-iqtree                              # optional: relatedness parameter must be set to true
| |-iqtree.treefile
|-ivar_trim
| |-sample.primertrim.bam             # aligned reads after primer trimming. trimmer parameter must be set to 'ivar'
|-ivar_variants
| |-sample.variants.tsv               # list of variants identified via ivar and corresponding scores
|-kraken2
| |-sample_kraken2_report.txt         # kraken2 report of the percentage of reads matching virus and human sequences
|-logs
| |-process_logs                      # for troubleshooting puroses
|-mafft                               # optional: relatedness parameter must be set to true
| |-mafft_aligned.fasta               # multiple sequence alignement generated via mafft
|-nextclade                           # identfication of nextclade clades and variants identified
| |-sample_nextclade_report.csv       # actually a ";" deliminated file
|-pangolin
| |-lineage_report.csv                # identification of pangolin lineages
|-samtools_ampliconstats
| |-sample_ampliconstats.txt          # stats for the amplicons used
|-samtools_coverage
| |-aligned
| | |-sample.cov.hist                 # histogram of coverage for aligned reads
| | |-sample.cov.txt                  # tabular information of coverage for aligned reads
| |-trimmed
|   |-sample.cov.trim.hist            # histogram of coverage for aligned reads after primer trimming
|   |-sample.cov.trim.txt             # tabular information of coverage for aligned reads after primer trimming
|-samtools_depth
| |-aligned
| | |-sample.depth.txt                # read depth for each read position
| |-trimmed
|   |-sample.depth.txt                # read depth for each position
|-samtools_flagstat
| |-aligned
| | |-sample.flagstat.txt             # samtools stats for aligned reads
| |-trimmed
|   |-sample.flagstat.trim.txt        # samtools stats for trimmed reads
|-samtools_plot_ampliconstats
| |-sample.*.png                      # images corresponding to amiplicon performance
|-samtools_stats
| |-aligned
| | |-sample.stats.txt                # samtools stats for aligned reads
| |-trimmed
|   |-sample.stats.trim.txt           # samtools stats for trimmed reads
|-seqyclean
| |-sample_clean_PE1.fastq            # clean file
| |-sample_clean_PE2.fastq            # clean file
|-snp-dists                           # optional: relatedness parameter must be set to true
| |-snp-dists                         # file containing a table of the number of snps that differ between any two samples
|-submission_files                    # optional: is only created if covid_samples.txt exists
| |-sample.genbank.fa                 # fasta file with formatting and header including metadata for genbank
| |-sample.gisaid.fa                  # fasta file with header for gisaid
| |-sample.R1.fastq.gz                # renamed raw fastq.gz file
| |-sample.R2.fastq.gz                # renamed raw fastq.gz file
|-summary
| |-sample.summary.txt                # individual results
|-summary.csv                         # tab-delimited summary of results from the workflow
reads
| |-sample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz    # initial file
| |-sample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz    # inital file
work                                  # nextflows work directory. Likely fairly large.
vadr
  |-vadr*                             # vadr output","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Complete output files structure","description":null,"can_edit":0,"guid":"7F28CFF0EB0F11EB8502BFC92E336DC9"}},"1":{"type":"command","mutability":"","data":{"id":9576,"name":"#Consensus Sequence Path:
/Full_Path_to_Cecret_Output_Directory/SRR11953697_cecret_output/consensus/SRR11953697.consensus.fa

/Full_Path_to_Cecret_Output_Directory/SRR11953697_cecret_output/summary.txt","os_name":null,"os_version":null,"command_name":"Cecret Consensus Sequence and Summary Report {"blocks":[{"key":"aromb","text":"Or upload the consensus sequence for each sample to the Nextclade clade assignment web portal at: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"14bbi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fkb7","text":"https://clades.nextstrain.org/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":30}],"data":[]},{"key":"a4mms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a79i7","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ci46c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"880g6","text":"The Nextclade server provides clade classification as well as QC metrics and a list of amino acid substitutions. A summary output file can be downloaded with the 'Export to CSV' button.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5c0ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rtuf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"50qb4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"E4E73FEE2C7F11EC932F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://clades.nextstrain.org"}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0BD3D1F02C8011EC8F1C79E9F6FFADA5","height":259,"id":179488,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8ija9","text":"NextClade assignment web portal","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"image (2).png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fqkebiqdx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frjabiqdx.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fri9biqdx.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"32DAF8502C8011EC8F1C79E9F6FFADA5","height":259,"id":179490,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3poan","text":"Nextclade clade assignment output","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"image (3).png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fqkgbiqdx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frjcbiqdx.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/frjbbiqdx.webp","width":550}}}}
